item.title: $init super refactor
item.description: Aaaand we’re back with another heavy hitting round of super refactorization in Terraform! I think the first iteration of Super Router for AWS went well. It allowed us to peer and route both intra-region and cross-region TGWs and VPCs with a single module and then “scale” them. But there was one really annoying flaw. The caveat in the design is that the peer TGWs will have to go through the Super Router’s local provider region to get to other peer TGWs.

item.title: Super Powered, Super Sharp, Super Router!
item.description: What’s up world?! Welcome back for moar spicy cloud networking Terraform takes because we servin’ them HOT over here so let’s dig in! This is a follow up to the generating routes blog post. TNT Architecture Recap The Terraform Networking Trifecta project demonstrated the ability to “scale” AWS VPCs in Terraform code by adding VPC objects to a list. Example VPC architecture but with ephemeral subnets: With Tiered VPCs we can narrow down the context (ie app, cicd, general) and maximize the use of smaller network sizes.
